item.title: Blocked select logging (deadlock finding) in golang
item.description: I’ve been writing some massively concurrent code for mgmt lately. The concurrency makes it incredibly bug prone. In this case it’s usually races or deadlocks. I’ve got a new trick to make the process more pleasant. The Problem: I’m sure many of you have written some code like this before: // just a small excerpt for { select { case <-someEvent: // some awesome thing happened! case <-ctx.Done(): return ctx.Err() } } And during debugging, you might have gotten frustrated and added some printf’s:
